title: Importance Sampling for Minimization of Tail Risks: A Tutorial. (arXiv:2307.04676v1 [q-fin.RM])
abstract: This paper provides an introductory overview of how one may employ importance sampling effectively as a tool for solving stochastic optimization formulations incorporating tail risk measures such as Conditional Value-at-Risk. Approximating the tail risk measure by its sample average approximation, while appealing due to its simplicity and universality in use, requires a large number of samples to be able to arrive at risk-minimizing decisions with high confidence. This is primarily due to the rarity with which the relevant tail events get observed in the samples. In simulation, Importance Sampling is among the most prominent methods for substantially reducing the sample requirement while estimating probabilities of rare events. Can importance sampling be used for optimization as well? If so, what are the ingredients required for making importance sampling an effective tool for optimization formulations involving rare events? translated_title: 最小化尾部风险的重要性抽样: 一个教程
translated_abstract: 本文为使用重要性抽样有效地解决包括条件风险价值等尾部风险度量的随机优化问题提供了一个简介性概述。通过对尾部风险度量进行样本平均逼近来进行风险最小化决策在使用上简单而广泛，但需要大量样本才能以高置信度得出决策。这主要是由于在样本中很少观察到相关的尾部事件。在模拟中，重要性抽样是大幅减少样本需求的最重要方法之一，用于估计罕见事件的概率。重要性抽样能否用于优化？如果可以，那么使重要性抽样成为应对涉及罕见事件的优化问题的有效工具所需的条件是什么？本教程旨在提供一个简介性的概述。
tldr: 本文提供了一个关于如何将重要性抽样有效地应用于解决包含尾部风险度量的随机优化问题的入门概述。
en_tdlr: This paper provides an introductory overview of how importance sampling can be effectively used to solve stochastic optimization problems involving tail risk measures.
